intro: Eveltria multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered evergreen, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually dark green and glossy, while its flowers bloom in shades of white and pale yellow. Eveltria multiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
